results.headline: Killers, The
results.summary_short: First 10 minutes or so, in the diner, pure Hemingway gold. Otherwise, very good pulp melodrama.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Killers

results.headline: Brief Encounter
results.summary_short: London train commuters. Memorable love story, via Coward, Lean and sounds of Rachmaninoff. A British jewel.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Brief Encounter

results.headline: Big Sleep, The
results.summary_short: Sleek, hard-boiled Chandler, though overly-intricate plotting. Good scene: Bogie and Dot Malone in bookshop.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Big Sleep

results.summary_short: That's his horse. Or was.

results.summary_short: Ambassador's daughter loves musician. Light, satisfying musical.

results.headline: Claudia and David
results.summary_short: Pleasant but rather innocuous. This one needs Goliath.

results.headline: Centennial Summer
results.summary_short: Mild family-comedy bauble, some nice Kern tunes. Best: ``In Love in Vain.''

results.headline: Easy to Wed
results.summary_short: Fast, brassy and funny, especially Lucy and Wynn.

results.headline: Stranger, The
results.summary_short: Fugitive Nazi masked as college prof. Brilliant.

results.headline: Of Human Bondage
results.summary_short: Maugham's clubfooted London artist-doctor falls for a cheap woman. Surprisingly effective. You may even prefer Parker's venum to Davis's volcanic tics.

results.summary_short: Good ice show background, rest middling.

results.headline: Dead of Night
results.summary_short: Pioneer British package of occult yarns and still champ. Our favorite yarns: hospital and mirror.

results.headline: Searching Wind, The
results.summary_short: Hellman play about passive American diplomat as Naziism spreads. Rather stacked but intelligent drama. Sylvia best.
